markdownRemark.html:
There is problem that has been tortured me for quite a long time, the scrolling of Flutter Web on iOS.

The scrolling is so weird, comparing to a native app or a traditional webpage, on iOS device. Safari or Chrome.

After flutter 3.7.0, as the announcement states:

Several scrolling updates have arrived with this release: polish and refinement for trackpad interactions, new widgets like Scrollbars and DraggableScrollableSheet, and improved handling for text selection within scrolling contexts.

Sure, the quality of scrolling improved in some aspects, but still feel "not native" / "friction is too strong" / "laggy" / "jank". In a word, Flutter Web does not scroll like a web.

As Dominik Roszkowski said in his blog:

Flutter is emulating scrolling from scratch. This means it has to handle different scroll physics implementations per platform, various input devices, and things like scrollbar on its own.

As this answer says:

We refer to this as "scroll physics" ... We are unlikely fix it entirely. It requires figuring out the right scroll physics per browser/platform, but we should be able to fix the most egregious situations.

I have the very same expectation as this guy puts it:

Flutter, for sure is cool and nice - like it a lot, but scrolling kills all UX

frontmatter.title: The Weird Feeling of Scrolling of Flutter Web
frontmatter.description: Compare with a native app or a traditional webpage, the scrolling behavior of a Flutter Web app is truly different.
